p: While its ‘old’ developing country discourses still exist, China’s ‘yinlingzhe’ narratives and discursive construction of its leadership in promoting international climate cooperation have constituted the crucial part of its overall construction of the Yinling Leading Power identity. In China’s national narratives, climate change governance has been transformed from a problem that developed countries should focus on to one of the most prominent domains that China shows international leadership and contributes to promoting international multilateral cooperation. Global climate governance has become one of China’s prototypical discursive frames in constructing its new international identity.
